POSTGRADUATE PROGRAMMES
=======================

![](https://fke.utm.my/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/fke-utm.jpg)

The **Faculty of Electrical Engineering** offers postgraduate programs leading to Master and Doctor of Philosophy degrees in Electrical Engineering. Our PhD degree is by research only, whereas our Master programs are conducted in either one of two modes of study – by research or by taught course.

#### PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS

[PROGRAM OFFERED](https://admission.utm.my/postgraduate-school-of-electrical-engineering/)
  
[ENTRY REQUIREMENTS](https://fke.utm.my/entry-requirements/)
  
[ENGLISH REQUIREMENT](https://admission.utm.my/english-language-requirements-3/)
  
[TUITION FEE (MALAYSIAN)](https://admission.utm.my/fees-pg-malaysian/)
  
[TUITION FEE (INTERNATIONAL)](https://admission.utm.my/fees-pg-inter/)
  
[LIVING & EXPENSES](https://fke.utm.my/postgraduate/estimated-living-expenses/)

[APPLY NOW!](https://admission.utm.my/apply-now/)

[FKE Seminar Series – Prof. Dr. Surender Reddy Salkuti](https://fke.utm.my/fke-seminar-series-prof-dr-surender-reddy-salkuti/)

===============================================================================================================================

Assalamualaikum and Salam Sejahtera,

All academic staff and students are cordially invited to attend a webinar co-organized by the FKE Seminar Committee and the IEEE Power Electronics Society (Malaysia Chapter), scheduled as follows:  
Speaker: Prof. Dr. Surender Reddy Salkuti  
Title: Sustainable Development with Renewable Energy and Electric Vehicle Technologies  
Date: 27 February 2025 (Thursday)  
Time: 2:30 PM – 4:00 PM  
Moderator: Dr Hasmat Malik

Meeting link: [HERE](https://utm.webex.com/utm/j.php?MTID=m393f51cb0c71241b0a23f4c10384ab9b)
  
Meeting number: 2513 030 5733  
Meeting password: drJnqJ36q23

We are looking forward to your participation. Thank you.

(CPD hour is awarded to staff, postgraduate students’ attendance will be recorded to fulfill the faculty’s requirement, certificate of attendance will be provided)

==========================================================================================================

All academic staff and students are cordially invited to attend a seminar organized by the FKE Seminar Committee, which is scheduled as follows:

Speaker: Speaker: Ts. Dr. Mohd Najeb bin Jamaludin  
Title: Advancing Wearable Technology: Innovations, Challenges, and Future Directions  
Date: 18 February 2025 (Tuesday)  
Time: 2:30 PM – 4:00 PM  
Venue: Active Learning Classroom, Level 5, P19a  
Moderator: Assoc. Prof. Ts. Dr. Zaid bin Omar

We are looking forward to your participation. Thank you.

(CPD hour is awarded to staff, and postgraduate students’ attendance will be recorded to fulfill the faculty’s requirement).

[FKE BMIE Research Seminar 2024-2](https://fke.utm.my/fke-bmie-research-seminar-2024-2/)

=========================================================================================

Invitation to BMIE Research Seminar 2024-2

Dear FKE Postgraduate Students,

We are delighted to extend our warmest invitation to the BMIE Research Seminar 2024-2.

Date : 14 August 2024 (Wed)  
Time : 8:30 am – 5:00 pm  
Location : BT9, Level 5, P19A, FKE

We are expecting your attendance to enrich the seminar with your valuable insights and expertise.

Your participation will be instrumental in creating a vibrant and intellectually stimulating event.

Looking forward to your presence at the BMIE Research Seminar 2024-2 !

[BIOINSPIRA Talk Series 3](https://fke.utm.my/bioinspira-talk-series-3/)

=========================================================================

Assalamualaikum wbt. and Greetings,

Dear all academic staffs and postgraduate students,

You are cordially invited to attend “BIOINSPIRA TALK SERIES 3: PROSTHETICS FASCINATING FACTS, SAFETY AND CONCERNS ” organized by BIOINSPIRA Research Group, which is scheduled as follows:  
**Date : 12th August 2024 (Monday)**  
**Time : 11:00 am – 1:00 pm**  
**Venue : BT9, P19A, FKE**

Speakers:  
1\. Assoc. Prof. Dr. Kheng-Lim Goh, Director of Research Group, Newcastle University, Singapore.

2\. Dr. Jennifer Olsen, Research Fellow, Newcastle University, United Kingdom

Moderator:  
Mr. Muhammad Faiz bin Md. Shakhih

Looking forward to your participation.

![](https://fke.utm.my/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/WhatsApp-Image-2023-06-12-at-2.42.58-PM.jpeg)

The Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering was introduced to complement the existing research master’s program.

…more

who already hold a master’s degree (in Master of Electrical Engineering or equivalent) and would like to expand and upgrade their knowledge.

This program produces human capital, which is not only intellectual and competent in modern and advanced technology but also versatile and capable of handling problems in real-life situations. Successful completion of the program will prove that candidates have successfully gone through comprehensive and rigorous research training. The Ph.D. thesis is expected to make a major contribution to the discipline by way of new knowledge.

The degree is awarded based on a comprehensive oral examination (viva voce) of the thesis submitted by the candidate on the completion of the study. Prospective graduate students should prepare themselves adequately, both in the fundamental subject matter necessary for advanced work and other branches of learning, so they may conduct quality research and successfully complete their programs.

##### Doctor of Philosophy

*   Doctor of Philosophy (Electrical Engineering) **PEEE**
*   Doctor of Philosophy (Biomedical Engineering) **PMBE**
*   Doctor of Philosophy (Health Science) **PMBH**

![](https://fke.utm.my/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/WhatsApp-Image-2023-06-12-at-2.42.58-PM-1.jpeg)

The Master of Philosophy (M.Phil.) offered at SKE is a research degree program for those holding a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering of the equivalent field who would like to

…more

expand and upgrade their knowledge. This multi-disciplinary program assists candidates to skills in high-level analysis and presentation, as well as integrate academic and professional concerns. Successful completion of the program will indicate that candidates have completed a course of research training. The M.Phil. thesis is expected to make an invaluable contribution of new knowledge or to the existing body of knowledge in the field.

The degree is awarded based on a comprehensive oral examination (viva voce) of the thesis submitted by the candidate on the completion of the study. Prospective graduate students should prepare themselves adequately, both in the fundamental subject matter necessary for advanced work and other branches of learning, so they may conduct quality research and complete their programs excellently.

##### Master of Philosophy

*   Master of Philosophy (Electrical Engineering) **MEEE**
*   Master of Philosophy (Biomedical Engineering) **MEEB**
*   Master of Philosophy (Rehabilitation Technology) **MEER**

![](https://fke.utm.my/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/WhatsApp-Image-2023-06-12-at-2.42.58-PM-4.jpeg)

Faculty of Electrical Engineering (FKE) offers Master program by taught course that provides students to study in one of our five specialized master’s programs.

…more

we offer a range of specialized courses founded on a unified philosophy of engineering teaching, which ensures the breadth of technical knowledge demanded of a professional engineer. Our curricular are in-line with industry needs.

##### Master By Taught Course

*   Master of Engineering (Electrical Power) [**MEEP**](https://fke.utm.my/electrical-power/)
    
*   Master of Engineering ( Mechatronics and Automatic Control) [**MEEM**](https://fke.utm.my/mechatronics-and-automatic-control/)
    
*   Master of Engineering (Computer and Microelectronic Systems) [**MKEH**](https://fke.utm.my/computer-and-microelectronic-system/)
    
*   Master of Engineering in Wireless Communication and Network [**MKET**](https://fke.utm.my/wireless-comm-and-network/)
    
*   Master of Science (Biomedical Engineering) [**MEBC**](https://fke.utm.my/biomedical/master-of-science-biomedical-engineering/)
